final_answer.precision_note: Rounded to 3 significant figures based on 0.150 mol dm-3 and measured titres/volumes.

method: Convert NaOH volume to dm3: 23.40 cm3 = 0.02340 dm3. Moles of NaOH used are n = cV = 0.150 x 0.02340 = 0.00351 mol. From H2SO4 + 2NaOH -> Na2SO4 + 2H2O, 2 mol NaOH react with 1 mol H2SO4, so n(H2SO4)=0.00351/2=0.001755 mol. Acid volume is 25.00 cm3 = 0.02500 dm3, hence c(H2SO4)=n/V=0.001755/0.02500=0.0702 mol dm-3.
checks: Units were converted to dm3 before applying concentration equations.
Stoichiometric factor of 2 for NaOH was applied from the balanced equation.
